Reviews.Title: “The location of the hotel good but that was it”
Reviews.Author: carolineday35
Reviews.Content: hi just back from wonderfull amsterdam but cant say the same for the hotel museumzicht it was a nice quite area and had the museum ryek just across the road, but the lady on recption was the most rude lady i ever met we knew the time of breakfast but decided to have our breakfast elsewere the first day which was no problem, on the morning of our leave which im glad to say we only stayed 2 nights, she knocked on our door more than once and we were nearly forced to have breakfast i however did not wish to have breakfast from someone so rude have to say would not be going to this hotel again due to the fact of this persons arrogance, its a pity really her manners could cost her a lot of profit

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sylv463
Reviews.Content: Traditional & reasonably priced for this expensive city.Short walking distance to all the major tourist sights. Good breakfast of juice, coffee or tea fresh breads, egg, cheese and ham, served from 8.30am in cosy room overlooking Rijksmuseum and street where bus to airport & trams to station stop.Staff friendly and very helpful.I happily left my luggage on departure day at reception. Single room in attic small but clean and warm. Shared shower & lavatory on each floor kept very clean.Would definately stay here again. Not suitable for the obese, disabled traveller as yes the stairs are steep-think boat- afterall this is Amsterdam. If you want the Hilton then no doubt there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Point is Location”
Reviews.Author: Ninster
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam last week , and based on the many good to great reviews chose this Hotel. The only thing good about the place is the Location, very close to Museums and the main tramp line Nos 5 which covers most of the key Amsterdam location is right outside the hotel. Its walking distance to shopping and multiple eating options of liedsplaine. Besides this I have nothing great to say about the place. The stairs are a climb for anyone and every age however fit you maybe, they are narrow and seems like a ladder has been put instead of the steps. If you plan to drink enough and come back, it better to climb it on all fours :) The breakfast which everyone raves about is purely basic and limited and extras are available depending on the mood of the server that day. We stayed for 3 nights and the 1st morning breakfast we had an elderly lady serving the breakfast who very rudely refuse to give us a 2nd round of paid orange also, stating she was too tied up with other guest...at any given time that room can only fit 4 tables, so i dnt understand her excuse...maybe she was having a bad morning, but that is no excuse to ruin the brakfast of paying guest...post that we never ate breakfast there even though it was included in our room rate...kinda demeaning for us. The rooms are very basic and ok on cleanliness. Certain rooms facing the tramp line can be noisy due the cars and tramp line starting early morning. If you are planning only crash and spen most of the day out then this may suit you...but then a little more research can get you far more for the price of 125 euro per night. Rest of the staff were fine, but for us the old hag totally spoilt it. We made our peace with the small rooms and tiny bathrooms. But what really got our goat was the not so friendly staff. One elderly woman in particular, who refused to give us a glass of orange juice while we were seated for breakfast. it was

Reviews.Title: “I liked it...”
Reviews.Author: nola_mike
Reviews.Content: Yep, those stairs are no joke. But you're in an old building in an old European city, so also somewhat cool I thought. Staff was very friendly, and I thought the breakfast was actually pretty good, with plenty to eat. In fact, I arrived at 9am, just hoping to stash my bags. Instead, the room was ready and they offered me breakfast/coffee. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was tiny, the common bathroom was equally tiny, even for Europe. Still, it was sufficient for me. The room was also old. The common room/breakfast area was a nice place to hang out. I couldn't get the internet to work, though I was able to sniff a free connection while sitting in the common room. Everything seemed clean enough. Location was pretty good, but I probably would have preferred to be a bit closer in. Still, it was only a 10 minute walk to anywhere that you'd want to go. Huge supermarket about a block away that I wish I had found out about sooner.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for ?”
Reviews.Author: boygeorgefan
Reviews.Content: Ok some people are saying the old woman comes across as a bit of a fuss pot she is but she doesn't mean any harm. It's just the way she is that's all. The place was decent, the rooms could of done with a refurbishment and a few lose electricals which was a concern, but this did not put me off. The place is clean in my opinion and the breakfast was brilliant and the dining area is very well furnished. Staff at this hostel are decent, the young lad was very friendly and helpful, don't worry about the manageress she maybe a little bit off putting but she won't bite. Value was average. Not a bad place to stay, stayed at much worst places but then again i have been to better.

Reviews.Title: “Unlikely to return”
Reviews.Author: louolou1
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews I read before I travelled, I was prepared for the stairs and so packed lightly and in a rucksack. I would advise anyone who can to do the same. The location is very good - handy for trams, buses and many attractions. I didn't find the tram noise a problem but anyone who expects quiet might. I actually found I slept better than usual. The lady who greeted us had an interesting manner (we met a few different staff during our four-night stay and none of them bowled me over with friendliness). She did show us many points of interest on the map she gave us. Also we were pleasantly surprised to be able to check in as soon as we arrived at the hotel (we only intended to drop our bags, but she checked for us, and there was a room ready). We were among the lucky ones who had booked an ensuite. The room dÃ©cor, however, was like that of an ascetic old lady. And our window (room no.4) was quite small and right in the corner. Two single beds masquerading as a double, not impressed! It's one thing when, as I've seen, the beds are dressed as one, but not only were they dressed singly, my mattress kept migrating from the bed, leaving a chasm between us. The beds were, however, very comfortable and the quilts warm. And the room was clean. I didn't mind not having a TV, but I really missed tea and coffee-making facilities (tea and coffee are available for 1.50). The breakfast room, as noted by many other reviewers, is charming and light-filled. The (brown) bread is delicious with a crunchy seedy crust. I would advise anyone who doesn't like the white of their egg runny to ask for a hard-boiled egg! I found the one slice of ham and one of cheese and charges for extras a little mean. Despite it's location, the rates are not cheap enough, in my opinion, to add extra charges. On one morning- but one morning only - my boyfriend, who requested no egg, was given an extra slice of each. No fruit, cereal or yogurt. There is no problem leaving your bags at the hotel after checking out, however you will be leaving them in the dining room, and some people may feel unsure of leaving valuables. I wouldn't be in a hurry to return, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great location!”
Reviews.Author: monicad76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: HappeeGee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just as you would expect from a value hotel in Amsterdam and benefits from an ideal location. Yes, the stairs are crazy and very steep (as you would expect the stairs in all the traditional houses in the city) they add to the charm and character of the experience. Our room was large, light and airy, with windows along one whole wall. It was very clean and perfectly functional for a long weekend. As with most hotels in Europe the 'double room' has twin beds pushed together rather than a double bed. The staff are polite and helpful but discrete. When we arrived we were given a map and shown were everything was including supermarkets, tram stops etc. The breakfast room is charming with dual aspect views across the Museum Zicht. This area is reasonably quiet compared to the centre of town, but close enough to walk to the action. There is a tram-stop right outside the door, a canal-bus 5 mins up the street and the airport bus also runs directly from here for as little as 4 euro. If you turn right out of the hotel and walk down the residential street to the end you will hit a quiet high-street with a number of small, intimate and reasonably priced bistros to eat in the evening if you aren't up for the crazy night-life that is a ten minute walk toward the centre. We can recommend the jazz club.

Reviews.Title: “It won me over...”
Reviews.Author: n69eil
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, right beside a tram line, it's just a quick tram journey from the airport and a quicker tram journey to the centre. There is noise obviously from the tram/buses, but not enough to disturb a sleep. I wasn't impressed at the amount of stairs to take, Dutch houses I guess, anybody that struggles with stairs might want to consider elsewhere. The actual place is like a B&B, the room was small, functional but above all, clean. They're not ensuite, so it was a case of communal shower and toilet which is a little uncomfortable at first, yet again, they were clean. Breakfast was included, ham, cheese, egg and toast with tea or coffee,, simple yet functional,, exactly what it appears the owners aimed for. The staff/manager, was friendly, recommended places to visit, can't really complain too much. Would recommend it, yes, although more to a younger group of friends rather than couples or those a bit older.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the edge of the city but close to essentials.”
Reviews.Author: JodyPilkington
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gr8 start to our trip. Relatively easy to find once we got off the bus at the museum. The stairs were epic as with all the stairs in Amsterdam- I recommend small suitcases for trips to Amsterdam- we had to lug a massive one up and down! Rooms were small and functional. comfy beds. Hotel is right next to a tram line so you do here it going past. Im a light sleeper so not the best sleep for me but fine for my fellow traveler who slept fine. Breakfast was fine but lacked fruit. Staff were helpful, some might fine them a little standoffish but that is just a culture difference-perhaps. Shower was nice and hot. sharing bathrooms was fine. They have a sweet little dog.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, would recommend to anyone for basic travel”
Reviews.Author: Scooby359
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, I wasn't expecting much from this hotel, but when I got there, I have to say, I was very pleased with it. It's based in the south-west of the city, just off from the Rijksmuseum and there's a tram station on the main road so a great location for travelling around. The hotel itself is one of the traditional Amsterdam buildings, so very tall! I'd read that the steps were steep, but getting in and seeing how steep still surprised me, something to be aware of if carrying a lot of luggage. The staff were friendly and helpful, when checking in, the lady gave me a map of the city and drew on points of interest like local markets and shopping areas. Again during breakfast, the staff were friendly and I had no problems. I had the single person room which was on the top floor. It was a nice room, with a huge window and a good view out, a very comfy bed, a desk and chair and a sink, towel and shelf in the corner. The room was nice and bright and very clean and even with the window open all night, had no problem sleeping - as there aren't many cars about, there's not much noise from outside. The toilet and showers are shared. On the top floor, they were just outside my room, but on the top floor, they were tiny. However, there was another shower and toilet on the middle floor which were a decent size, and again, very clean. Despite them being shared, I never had to wait to use the toilet or shower. The breakfast was good - boiled egg, cheese, ham breads, toasts and jams with juice, tea and coffee. Outside the dining area was also a notice board with lots of little bits of advice, places to eat, shops worth seeing, tram times, etc. Was useful and nice to get some pointers of where to go. The hotel also has free wifi throughout. Overall, it is a basic hotel, so there's no frills like tv's in your room, but it was nicer than I expected and to get bed and breakfast for that price I thought was very reasonable. If I head back to Amsterdam, I'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: C0CKR0ACH
Reviews.Content: I didn't plan well, so I did book a room late, we had to share the bathroom with more guests, that didn't bother me, it's like being a student again :-) The hotel is NOT dirty, I do pay close attention to that. It is an old building, but what would one expect in downtown Amsterdam? If you want a new hotel, there are some 10km out of town. But if you really want to enjoy Amsterdam, the hotel has an unbeatable location. The staff was friendly, I did email them to let them know our late arrival, they replied with instructions not to worry, and how to take bus 197 from the airport that stops right at the hotel doorstep (no need for expensive taxi transport) This hotel is NOT for old people due to the stairs, they have actually managed to put 3 stories of stairs into what normally would be an elevator shaft. This is common in Amsterdam. The breakfast is NOT bad. I weight 120kg and it was enough food to get me through the morning. I'll be staying there next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value and location”
Reviews.Author: CinnamonBun
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after weeks of looking online - in general, accommodation prices in Amsterdam are quite expensive and we were looking for a good value in an accessible area; this seemed like a good choice. The hotel ended up being pretty much exactly as we expected - outdated, yes, but also quite comfortable. We slept better here than anywhere else! The breakfast was great - soft boiled egg, toast, ham, cheese, coffee and juice. I had been a bit concerned about sharing a bathroom and shower, but during the whole 4 days there I didn't have to wait once to use either. The only thing that bothered me about this place was an odd and permeating smell - thankfully, our room didn't have it (otherwise this would have been a problem), so it ended up just being a minor inconvenience when we were passing through the halls and eating breakfast. We also found the staff to be a little...cold, though they were courteous enough during formal interactions. They had a small laptop for guest use, however every time we asked to borrow it, they seemed annoyed. Overall, it was a pretty enjoyable stay for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, helpful staff (more like a b&b style hotel)”
Reviews.Author: mightygeo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located kitty corner of the hobbestraat tram stop as well as the Rijkmuseum, which makes it easy to find. It is also located next to the big shopping street. It 3 blocks from Van Gogh and 5 blocks from a grocery store. The rooms are small (so everything in Europe) but clean. They provide soap and shampoo. There is a sink in the room and tiolet and shower down each hall. The breakfast is coffe, oj, cheese slice, egg, and ham with unlimited bread. The hotel is tastefully decorated with antiques. They provide free wifi. The hotel is on the second floor and there is not a elevator. I know some of the comments mention the steep stairs, I personnally dint think they were that bad- they are typical Dutch stairs and you will also need to climb these type of stairs at Anne Franks Musuem... Overall, great value and location for seeing Amsterdam. If you are more into the sites of the city, this is a prime location. If you are there more for the coffeeshops and redlight district I would recommend the Dam location. Also note, that bus 197 from the airport stops at the Hobbestraat tram stop (cost 4 euro, takes about 25 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: PegGallag
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel based on its location and reviews. We found the manager to be beyond rude and I would never stay there again. It was uncomfortable to watch how cruel she treated her staff. This hotel is in a great spot, but just down the street are two wonderful hotels that enjoy being hospitable. It was worth walking the extra block to stay away from the inhospitable woman that manages Muzeumzicht.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: d339fy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of previous good reviews on trip advisor in the price range, although unfortunately our stay was pretty terrible! As other reviews mention, the hotel is up an incredibly steep and long staircase, which was OK, although the putrid smell that greeted us was far from welcoming! The check in time was 1pm, although the room had not been cleaned at 3.30pm when we arrived. The room was the double with en-suite, and comprised a basic room in need of renovation, with two single beds pushed together. If i'm honest at this point I was still optimistic and wasnt going to let this disrupt our holiday, however things soon deteriorated: - used soap provided in bathroom (with nicely adhered body hair) - tram lines run below room window: sound like a rocket taking off every 3 minutes throughout the night - perhaps the final nail in the coffin occurred during otherwise pleasant breakfast - upon finishing a piece of toast, my sleepy eyes noticed that the butter packet has been nicely chewed by a mouse!!! Gross!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location. What an adventure. Fresh flowers are a lovely touch also.”
Reviews.Author: harley95girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel. We were very happy with the owner and staff. The room had no air conditioning, but none was needed. Our room had large windows that we left open day and night. Weather was perfect. Breakfast was a welcomed surprise - unlimited coffee or tea; 1 egg, toast, cheese, ham and orange juice. The stairs leading to the office are not for the faint at heart. In fact, we almost left before climbing them_______ however, if we had it would have been our loss! We had a great stay at this hotel and would come back again. Within blocks of everything touristy. Enjoy:) Debi and Marie

Reviews.Title: “Better alternative to hostels for the traveler on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: tomwatret
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend over the world cup final weekend. Booked at last minute for about the same price as hostels were going for. It is without a doubt incredible value for money. Free (basic) breakfast with unlimited coffee and toast (that you have to be persistent to get the most out of), amazing location, clean, safe; a real base to work from in the city. Couldn't recommend it more. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Charming But....”
Reviews.Author: JamesVarick
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I noted the VERY steep steps and there are many of them as the hotel lobby is on the third floor. I didn't mind this as I realize this is the charm of Amsterdam... But be forewarned... if you are not in tip top shape you are in for a fitness trial. After making it to the Lobby I was greeted by a pleasant owner, it seems that within moments of realizing I was a single guy traveling in Amsterdam her charming demeanor changed to complete skepticism... I tried to reassure her that I was only there to see the fantastic art collections but her attitude didn't seem to change. The situation soon went even further south after I saw my single room. I would have to agree with the other reviewers when I say that the single room was a disgrace not fit for any use other than a broom closet. Bottom line: DO NOT BOOK THE SINGLE ROOM. I am generally non-confrontational but claustrophobia and panic got the better of me and after consulting my boyfriend on the phone I mustered up the courage to ask for a better room. Upon my request she asked "Why?" and "Claustrophobic?" ... If you know the room makes people claustrophobic than why is it even a room??? After agreeing to pay an additional ten euro I was given my choice of two double rooms which were a world of a difference. They were quirky and cute and even had real windows. My experience of the hotel improved after the change and the owner even seemed to warm up to me though not enough to make me feel completely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, stairs are a pain”
Reviews.Author: carlyb_unc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The service was good as the owner offers to help you get accustomed to the city by explaining the map and breakfast is served every morning at reasonable hours. The main problem at this hotel is the stairs. While they are managable, going up them with 20 kilo/45 pound backpacks was not fun, I cannot imagine the trip with a large suitcase. Without luggage the stairs still get you winded, especcially if traveling all the way up to the third floor. Here is a video that shows the steepness and length of the stairs, we found it quite entertaining. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A53Ihw1k3jg&feature=channel So if willing to get winded on each journey to your room, this hotel has great service, clean rooms and public bathrooms and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad, Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: superdax
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler in a room with two beds (had no other choice due to late booking), and the extra bed left almost no room to move. No one is in their hotel room in Amsterdam anyway, but if there are two friends traveling thru the city and looking for a cheap room, the size may discourage you (the beds were up against the walls and there was about a foot between the two...with really no wiggle room on either end). The staff situation is interesting. There was a younger girl that I thought was terrific. Knowledgeable of the city/transportation/etc. Friendly, willing to help, great. The owner was flat out rude to me each time I spoke with her. She has no desire to be helpful or affable. I asked her if there was a nearby cafe that she could recommend, and she responded with a sneer and "A cafe??? At this time???" The "time" was lunchtime. Then she gave me a half-hearted point in some direction, and mumbled something. I even tried 'killing her with kindness' at one point, thanking her for breakfast and effusively wishing her a nice afternoon, and it was still greeted with aloofness and rudeness. The stairs are slightly insane: almost vertical in their steepness, extremely narrow, very tough to navigate with luggage. But then, the novelty of it is almost fun. Breakfast I thought was good to very good. As much bread (white or wheat) as you want, along with an assortment of jams, nutella, honey, butter. A boiled egg, ham, cheese, a small OJ, plus coffee or tea. You eat in a neat old room with the other guests, and there is fitting music playing gently. I didn't have a shower/toilet in my room, but, at least on the second floor, it wasn't an issue. Both of the communal rooms (one for toilet, one for shower) were kept clean, and there wasn't much of a congestion issue in my three nights there. There was construction going on outside hotel, and with no A/C and my window open, I was woken up to the sound of jackhammers one morning. But obviously I can't blame the hotel for that. The hotel is a good value and has a nice location near the major hotels and not far from the Leidesplain area. Bus 197 took me from nearby directly to the airport, which was nice. Free WiFi too. Don't break your neck on the stairs (and pack lightly), ignore the rudeness of the owner, and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a great location; an amazing value for a relatively cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: trevorsm
Reviews.Content: I chose the Museumzicht because I'd seen it recommended and because the price fit my budget, though I was initially unsure about the location. After arriving in Amsterdam by train, I hopped on tram line 2/5 expecting to get lost, but to my surprise, I got dropped off literally right in front of the hotel. I was very enthusiastically greeted by the staff and given plenty of ideas of things to see. Then came the room: number 8. I booked a single room without a bathroom; I was expecting it to be tiny, and indeed it's one of the smallest I've stayed in. Truth be told though, it was the perfect size. The room had a huge window that opened to a huge balcony (bigger than the room!) and such a lovely view. The toilet was behind the door just adjacent to the room, and the sink in the room makes a big difference. If you're still scared about the tiny room, keep in mind that the double rooms are quite a bit larger, and some have private bathrooms if you require one. Now the location... Don't waste your money on a several day tram pass because everything in the city is within walking distance once you orient yourself to the layout. If you can't stand walking though, don't fear because the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, and Cocertgebouw are visible from the hotel, and Leidseplein-which has every kind of food you could need as well as several nice bars and coffeeshops-is just a few blocks in the other direction from the museum. You can even catch a wonderful canal cruise not more than two blocks away. Lastly, if the value weren't good enough already, the free breakfast matched anything you'd get at a bed and breakfast type place. The breakfast room is lovely and overlooks the Rijksmuseum. The seating is open so the guests tend to actually talk to each other during breakfast instead of just keeping to themselves at their assigned tables like at many places. If you're at all considering a stay in Amsterdam, GO because it's a lovely and unique city that you must experience at least once, and you can't go wrong by staying at Museumzicht.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Robby007
Reviews.Content: Nice character, budget accommodation. Excellent location for many museums also very close to the Vondel park and a major area of bars and eateries. Can be a little noisy with tram stops outside etc but not untypical for a city hotel. You must be able to cope with the typical Amsterdam steep staircases. Staff were freindly and helpful. Breakfast was basic but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_VZ
Reviews.Content: -This was more or less the cheapest hotel we could find in Amsterdam at the time we booked (around a month before our four night stay over the Whitsun weekend.) However it turned out to be very good value and certainly contributed to an excellent first impression of the city for me, and an enjoyable return for my boyfriend. Quite a long walk from the city centre, this gives some breathing space with Museumplein and the Vondelpark nearby. Many attractions and restaurants are within easy walking distance and as well as the trams and buses, canal boats depart from nearby Singelgracht. -The 120 year old building has huge character, especially those stairs. There are a total of 80 from the street to the top floor, and around 45 even to the lowest level. They are indeed very narrow so there's no chance to leave in a rush if you see your tram approaching out of the window! Not too much of a problem if you are relatively fit though. The stairs and hall are well decorated with posters and tips on things to see and do. -Our room was small but practical; twin beds (soft and comfortable) pushed together underneath the attic beams, two chairs, a coffee table, wardrobe and sink. No TV or phone, but if you have as busy holiday as we did, you won't need them! The hotel does offer wi-fi and if you don't bring a laptop, the staff will search things online for you, such as transport routes and the weather forecast. The room's sash window gave adequate ventilation in the mid 20s Celsius weather, but might provide a draught in winter. Noise from the tram stop outside might give you problems if you have trouble sleeping; I wore earplugs on the first night rather than shut the window. -A sign in reception warned about the risk of mice but I saw no evidence of them, even when I mistakenly left an apple on the floor while out for the day. The room and importantly, the toilet and shower, were both as clean as could be. The latter on the top floor are both small, but I had no problems with them. Make sure you give yourself a few extra minutes in the morning in case they are occupied when you want to use them. Other guests can also cause noise problems tramping up and down the stairs in the early hours, because you're given a front door key so you can come and go whenever you please. -Breakfast was good: unlimited bread or toast, with a boiled egg, cheese and ham, jams and other spreads, orange juice, and tea or coffee. Certainly enough for a busy day's sightseeing, and all organic/free range. It is not served before 8:30 however. The owner's Jack Russell likes to play ball in the mornings, but if you don't like dogs, she's easy to avoid. -One piece of important info: the hotel charges 5% on credit cards, TAKE CASH to pay for your room when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time's a European Charm :)”
Reviews.Author: MenBobbyMcGee
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in a year visiting Amsterdam- this time with my Hubby & Dad visiting from the USA. We originally had tried to book a couple nights during the popular "Queens Day" celebrations, but sadly, the hotel was booked up, so we settled for the Sun/Mon preceding the festivities. The hotel was just as I remembered and I had advised my Dad & Hubby about the steep stairs, small rooms, loo & shower down the hall etc. but they were still game and were totally charmed with Jackie the dog and the lovely eclectic breakfast room & cheerful service. The parking fairies were looking over us when we lucked-out and got a free spot (Sunday) right in front of the hotel. The next morning we moved the car over to the P+R lot at the Stadium at a SUPER BARGAIN for only 6euros a day including the bus tix to get to & fro. HIGHLIGHTS of our trip included a visit to the "Artis Zoo" - they let the lemurs run freely around the visitors and they are NOT SHY :) We checked out the local jazz scene, enjoying two nights of shows featuring a FAB musician named Rene van Beeck- he sang, played the flugel horn & upright bass. ROOMS: We booked the last two available rooms; they were on the top floor and the smallest in the building. They were charming and we didn't mind. There was a sink in each room. The toilet and shower were SUPER small on this floor. I would guess the WC is smaller than the economy class facilities on a budget airline. We managed, and did okay. After comparing prices in the Amsterdam area, I found that you can NOT GET A BETTER VALUE for your $ than the Hotel Museumzicht in Amsterdam. We are already booking early for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - fair deal for a low cost short stay”
Reviews.Author: freakytsz
Reviews.Content: OK given that we didn't want to spend much for a weekend trip in this expensive city. Location is its best attribute - right next to Van Gogh and Rijks and well connected with trams 2 and 5, but the rest is just marginal. Most rooms come without private bathroom so have to share with the rooms on the floor.... this is still OK. Rooms are clean and beds are comfy. One last fact - Under my bed there was a mouse trap with a piece of cheese, and also a box full of poison pills for the rats so... should one go to bed expecting the catch of the night?

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Budgeterian
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect hotel for me regarding location, price, service, cleanliness...but maybe not for everyone. The staff at reception was friendly and helpful, the room was immaculately clean though not new. I booked a single room with shared bathroom and paid 45 euros for a night, it was one of the low budget accomodation in Amsterdam. A simple breakfast was included in the price, consisting of a choice of white or brown bread with a selection of jam and nutella, orange juice, an egg, and tea or coffee. Situated in the historical museum district, the location was just amazing... right in front is the bus stop for the bus to the airport, (which runs frequently) and opposite the road is the Rijkmuseum where you can see many of the Dutch Art Masterpieces. Restaurants, bars and cafes are only a stop away by tram. However, I would not recommend this hotel to a traveller wth large/heavy bags or in need of a lift, as the only way to get from the front door to the reception is by climbing up a long narrow staircase. They seemed to have no lifts. I also do not recommend the shared bathroom on the top floor to anyone who needs space, as they both (shower and the toilet) are the size of a large closet. I enjoyed this 'traditional Amsterdam house' hotel with warmth and steep stairs, and would like to visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for museums and perfect drop off from the airport”
Reviews.Author: PAWross
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel with incredibly steep staircase. All a little quirky with unusual furniture and style. Breakfast just fine. Price represented good value for money. Owner fine on advising places to visit etc. but on our leaving day we had to depart at 8.00 a.m. and breakfast was at 8.30. On asking if we could have anything (having paid in advance for b & b) we were simply told 'no'. A bowl of fruit or perhaps a yoghurt would have been a kind thought and would have helped us to leave the hotel with a lasting good impression - instead we thought 'oh well, they're not much interested'.

Reviews.Title: “An integral part of our Amsterdam experience.”
Reviews.Author: Flashback_travels
Reviews.Content: For the six days that we spent in Amsterdam, the Hotel Museumzicht became our base for exploring the city. The delicious morning breakfast was served in a community room with a wonderful view, inside and out. The unique decorations of the hotel have a museum quality of their own. Our room was warm and comfortable as snow was falling outside. The staff provided many suggestions for things to see and do in the city. The close proximity to great museums proved a major plus for us. Having public transportation near the hotel made it easy to get around although most sights are in walking distance. We hope to return one day! Thank you, Hotel Museumzicht!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: Satpriti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in October. I was charmed by the owner, the small room (with a view), and the wonderful breakfasts with a toaster at the tables in the lovely breakfast room overlooking the Museumplein. As a solo-woman traveler, new to Amsterdam, I was thankful for the tips. The location was perfect, near the Film Museum, the markets, the musuems, the Pip, the bike rentals, lots of restaurants and of course the canals. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: luigi330
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Museumzicht and look forward to returning there on my next visit to Amsterdam. I didn't expect to stop in Amsterdam this trip, and called the hotel looking for an inexpensive single room at the last minute. The owner (?) was very helpful over the phone and helped me save a few more Euros by telling me which bus to take from Schiphol airport and thereby avoid a taxi or train & tram ride in. Once at the hotel, I was able to easily get around the city using the tram system which stops by the front door. My single room was small with a sink in it, with the toilet and shower out in the hall. All were clean. I never had to wait for either the bathroom or shower. If they were occupied on my floor, I'd just try one on the other floors. The breakfast room is very cheery, flower-filled, and bright, and I enjoyed my meals there. A very nice place to enjoy your breakfast as you look down at a back corner of the Rijksmuseum. The hotel's little Jack Russell Terrier, Jackson, was fun to watch as she greeted guests in the morning. In the reception area, the owner had put up lots of information about things to do and she came over while I was looking things over. Using a large city map she has mounted on the wall, she pointed out where some of the things were that I was interested in. I wish I had had more time, since so much was nearby - The Rijksmuseum, The Van Gogh Museum, and the Concertgebouw classical music hall were all just a few minutes away on foot. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: citytripper2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed some time in this charming hotel that is a small climb up the stairs for your daily exercise. The furniture is real antique, art nouveau style that gives the hotel a cosy warm feeling. The view from the breakfast room is splendid, so is the personally served breakfast. Personel is nice too and service is great. The rooms are nice. I payed for a bathroom on the hallway as that was ok to me. Internet was free and unlimited which was surprising for the price. All in all a very charming hotel with great service and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff and accomodations were excellent - the breakfast was a special treat - the dog served as humorous entertainm”
Reviews.Author: wholzworth
Reviews.Content: I was able to book a room when I got off the train at the information center. The hotel is in the museum district with a trolley stop across the street. Last day there I found a note asking to call reception. She asked if I could change rooms as some folks needed the room with a rollout bed. I found myself in the best room in the house. wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: kyky023
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel. It did have a lot of steep stairs, but no problem! The breakfast was very cute and simple. The room was small, the beds were nice and clean. The bathroom was small, but always clean. The location was great. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No thanks... much friendlier proprietors and better values out there!”
Reviews.Author: soflaswampthing
Reviews.Content: When recently in Amsterdam, I considered staying at the Museumzicht for the second half of my trip, based largely on all the glowing reviews I had read online. I emailed the hotel in advance for a quote, and when I got there I dropped by to take a look at the place. I like to see a place in person before committing to it for a lengthy period: in this case, I am glad I dropped by before reserving. The hotel is a lovely old building right next to the Rijksmuseum. While initially favorably impressed from the exterior, my actual experience with the hotel was not pleasant. I rang the bell and walked up a couple of flights of (steep) stairs to the reception area, where I was greeted by a hotel staff member. I explained that I was looking for a room for the next week, and asked to see one before committing. Her reception wasn't exactly welcoming, but it wasn't completely offputting, either... that changed soon after I climbed two more flights of stairs to look at a small single room, though. She handed me the key and sent me off to look at the room on my own. I spent a couple of seconds taking it in. I sat on the edge of the bed, trying to imagine whether or not I could subsist in a room the size of a broomcloset with the depressing aura of a flophouse for the next week. Almost immediatley, the staff person -- apparently concerned that I had spent too long in the room -- came bustling in, exuding an air of ill-concealed suspicion. She was obviously put out that I had sat on the corner of the bed and, after making an exaggerated show of straightening a small wrinkle in the bed covering, she ushered me out. What had started as a luke-warm reception turned downright chilly. In an attempt to lighten the mood, I tried to chat about the weather, the view... anything to establish a positive connection. In return, she accused me of taking advantage of her good will and wasting her time for my "entertainment." If I weren't seriously considering staying there, I certainly could have found better things to do in Amsterdam than walking up four flights of stairs to spend 30 seconds in a depressingly spartan hotel room and be insulted for my interest. In short, I am incredibly glad that I did not make a reservation at the Museumzicht in advance without seeing the hotel and meeting the staff first! Completely aside from the attitude problems on the part of the staff, the room I saw was the very definition of sad -- claustrophobic and cheaply furnished with a bare minimum of disposable items. Bathroom facilities in the hallway bordered on unusable due to their liliputian dimensions. I suspect that doubles are probably much nicer and more livable, but I didn't dare ask to see one, based on the attitude of the staffperson. I certainly would not recommend a single room in this hotel without checking it out first so you know what you are getting into. (A few years ago, this sort of room could have been had for the equivalent of $30 or less per night. It is shocking that it can now command two or three times that, and that it comes with a heaping helping of contempt from the staff, as a bonus.) Ultimately, I wound up choosing a room in another part of town. For $15 a night more, it was furnished very comfortably, had about five times the space of the Museumzicht's single, and it featured a kitchen with stove and refrigerator, as well as private bath. It also came with something a lot more valuable: hospitable and welcoming proprietors, who made me feel like a valued guest, rather than like a pariah. In short, you can do a lot better than the Museumzicht for the price. In all fairness, maybe I caught the staff on a bad day or at an inconvenient time, but I have to say that in decades of traveling the world, from Africa to Europe and South America, I have rarely felt so unwelcome at a hotel. The staff person attempted to recover a bit as a left, saying that it was "nothing personal" that she had been so suspicous and accusatory... but I don't think anyone would call that a welcoming reception that would entice him/her to stay there. Museumzicht, you are off my list of places to stay next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “with great comfort”
Reviews.Author: malaAmsaterdam
Reviews.Content: In the summer of 2008, my mother and myself stayed 3 weeks in the sphereful Hotel Museumzicht in the Jan Luykenstraat in Amsterdam. This hotel is situated in the most wanted area, for houses, in Amsterdam. The style of the hotel is like the old canal-houses, inside you feel immediately as if it is your own house. The staff is very friendly and they speak many languages. The rooms are very clean but most of all it's staying in a beautiful, not too big hotel, in the center of this beautiful city, no better place to find to spend your holidays in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “"Good choise - homey and quite cheap"”
Reviews.Author: Gogoer
Reviews.Content: This was perfect hotel for us! Not luxurious but very homey. The room wasn't huge but big enough. Breakfast is served in nice salon with flowers and good views. Staff is very friendly and ready to give you tips where to go. If you are lucky you can have a little play with owner's 10-years-old dog Jacki. (Everybody is talking about the stairs but those are just stairs - just climb up!)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully quaint hotel in the center of Amsterdam..”
Reviews.Author: Designer09
Reviews.Content: We have had a great weekend staying at this little hotel. The room was clean and nicely decorated with antique furniture. We especially loved the view over the museumplein. It's a bit of a climb (no elevator), but well worth it! There is art and antiques everywhere, and the breakfastroom alone is like a little museum.

Reviews.Title: “A flower-filled hotel with a homey atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MOJIN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam for two to three weeks every year since 2002, including this year, and always chosen this hotel as if it was my second home. I happened to know of the hotel when I searched for hotels which offered most reasonable prices and had a homey atmosphere at a tourist information center near Amsterdam Centraal railway station. You will find the homeyness of a typical Dutch home in the friendly customer service and the furnishings with traditional Dutch designs as well as its 150-year-old building. I also enjoy the music played during breakfast very much. Another favorable feature I would like to point out is that the owner of the hotel personally arranges fresh flowers in the lovely vases on the dining tables every day, which you will enjoy at meal times. In addition, the hotel is conveniently located, roughly in front of Amsterdamâ€™s main art gallery and museum. It is needless to say that I really like the reasonable prices and all the amenities, but I give my best praise to the owner and employees for their hospitality. I have always felt that they attend to each and every guest wholeheartedly, and love their guests and the hotel, which makes me extremely happy and gives me the pleasure of staying there. If you are thinking of a nice, memorable trip to Amsterdam, this hotel is worth consideration. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It just like a Museum”
Reviews.Author: rin101
Reviews.Content: There are many small buildings site in Amsterdam. Such a building always have steep stairs. This hotel is so, too. When you open the door, you see the steep stairs. I think it's just like Amsterdam! Though you have to go up the stairs, the worker of the hotel may help you if you need. This hotel is very near from both the Tram station and the Museumplein. It is worthy of special mention about this hotel there are wonderful paintings, flower vases, lights and so on. It is suitable to this hotel's name! Be careful for not making loud because sounds are heard in neighboring rooms easily. And I liked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Climb the stairs, it's worth it!!!! Great little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: janefromstockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Museumzicht for 4 nights in a nice decorated and clean double room with shower and toilet down the hall which was shared with just a few other rooms but was always kept verry clean and fresh. The hotel staff were friendly and helpfull and serve a nice "Dutch" breakfast in the beautifull breakfastroom with great view on the Rijksmuseum wich is only about 3 steps away. This hotel is located in a typical old dutch house with lots of stairs . I absolutely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: shikakai
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with KaizerSoze_SF's assessment of this hotel. First, the stairs. They are seriously steep and narrow and numerous. I also realized that as someone in my late-thirties I have probably earned the comfort to not have to haul bags up so many stairs. I guess it was a lesson learned that I should have paid more and stayed at a more comfortable place. It is not surprising that most of the guests during my stay at the hotel were all well below 30, and often partied up a storm in the evenings. The single room, as mentioned below, felt worse than a cell, was very poorly appointed with not even a rug on the cold floor or a proper chair to sit on; the walls were dirty and stained. Perhaps the double rooms are much better. The breakfast room is indeed very charming and the breakfast was quite nice, too, but these were poor compensation for the killer stairs, the abysmal single room, and the even smaller shower and toilet. Yes, it is true that the location is excellent but, then again, Amsterdam is so small that most of it is easily accessible. Finally, I didn't find the staff to be particularly friendly, contrary to what other reviewers have said. They were rather brusque.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tatlin
Reviews.Content: Great little cosy hotel, in a wonderful location. All the major museums are outside your door. There is a tram stop just outside. 5 stops to DAM square. Very clean. Great breakfast room. Funny dog. Typical Amsterdam house. If you have a problem with steep stairs it might be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: elizmeadows
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Hotel Museumzicht for 2 nights. The view was fantastic and the room clean. There are quite a few stairs, but not very bad if you're prepared for it. The breakfast and breakfast room are nice. And you can't beat the location! We had a view of the Rijksmuseum from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay without breaking the bank!”
Reviews.Author: ksrinlv
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Museumplein with a tram stop in front of the hotel. The previous reviews aren't kidding - lots of steep narrow steps, pack light! My room was small but more than adequate, comfortable, clean, loved having the sink in my room. The toilet & shower rooms were tiny on my floor but just one floor down they were plenty roomy. Breakfast was very good in a delightful breakfast room, loved it. Larissa was good to share some recommendations with a map to help get orientated to the city. Overall if you're looking for an American-type hotel experience you won't like it; if you're looking for a typical European experience you'll be quite pleased! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: suitscase
Reviews.Content: Location is good, lovely old building and the stairs were not as bad as some reviews indicate but could be a problem if you are disabled or elderly. However the place smelled strongly of cat urine, there was animal hair on the carpets in the room and there is a grumpy nippy little dog. All in all I will look for another place next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good but lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: JK01
Reviews.Content: And there were lots of stairs. Immediately inside the door, guests must climb to the 3rd floor reception, and most room are one or two floors above that, and all are very steep and narrow steps. The elderly or disabled would face great difficulty here. The breakfast is simple but good, and the breakfast room has greats views of the Rijksmuseum across the street. The double room had a sink but no bathroom, and is one the expensive side at 75 Euros, as it was very small as well and had no extras like TV, refrigerator, or air conditioning. Staff was friendly and helpful, but their 5% fee for credit cards is a little high as I believe that more than covers their costs for using credit card services. On the last night, other guests were young and clearly in Amsterdam for a party, and that would be fine if the staff had been willing to do something about their noise or the shared bathrooms that these young guests chose to trash. Good location for the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, but a long walk from the central area.

Reviews.Title: “love this place!”
Reviews.Author: snickle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times in the last five years and have a sentimental attachment to it. The folks who run it are wonderful, and it's homey and comfy. It's an amazing location, just on the Museumplein, on the tram line two blocks from the Leidseplein. I highly recommend it!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Museumzicht
HotelInfo.Address: Jan Luijkenstraat 22, Amsterdam 1071 CN, The Netherlands
